Panjab Notes and Queries
EDITOR’S OFFICE
AMBÁLÁ, PANJÁB, INDIA Dated 4 May 1884
div.p: Yours of 14th March last, which I ought to have answered before, but the overwhelming amount of work I have to get through from day to day is my excuse.

As soon as I can find a spare moment I’ll sort my M.S.S. on the
subject of corrupt English & send them you to use. I warn you that they are very bulky, and not very easy to read! I spent great labour over them 10 years ago. I do not think they are sufficiently digested for me to attempt to publish them as they stand & I could not possibly undertake to rewrite them now. However if they find their way into type through your kind offices I shall be to that extent greatly indebted to you.
I have subscribed to the rescue of Mélusine
Mélusine, recueil de mythologie, littérature populaire, traditions et usages, Paris 1.1878-11.1892 (dann Erscheinen eingestellt). & am going to use it to advertise my various notes. I send a prospectus which will interest M. Gaidoz & it will interest him & other folklorists to know that I have been given the Editorship of the Dict. of Proverbs in Hindustani left in M.S.S. by the late Dr Fallon,Kein Bibliotheksnachweis. author of the New Hindustani Dict.Samuel W. Fallon,
A new Hindustani-English Dictionary, with Illustrations from Hindustani Literature and Folk-Lore
, Banaras: Lazarus and Co., 1876ff. There are 12,500 proverbs in the new work.

I suppose you know of Burnell & Yule’s Discursive Glossary of Anglo-Indian terms!
Henry Yule, Arthur Coke, Burnell Hobson-Jobson, Being a Glossary of Anglo-Indian Colloquial Words and Phrases and of Kindred Terms Etymological, Historical, Geographical and Discursive, Cambridge University Press, 1886.
But it is a book
you ought to buy.

We are all losers in India by the death of our great publisher Nicholas Trubner.Der in Heidelberg geb. Verleger Nikolaus Trübner (in Großbritannien Nicholas Trubner) war am 30. März 1884 in London im Alter von 67 Jahren verstorben.
